import { useState } from 'react'

export const Highlight = ({ children }) => (
  <span style={{ background: '#fff3cd', padding: '0.2rem 0.4rem', borderRadius: '6px' }}>
    {children}
  </span>
)

export const Callout = ({ title, children }) => (
  <div style={{
    borderLeft: '4px solid #6366f1',
    background: '#eef2ff',
    padding: '1rem',
    margin: '2rem 0',
    borderRadius: '8px'
  }}>
    <strong>{title}</strong>
    <div>{children}</div>
  </div>
)

<style>{`
.blog-content img {
  width: 100%;
  max-width: 900px;
  margin: 2rem auto;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 14px;
}
.blog-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(240px, 1fr));
  gap: 1rem;
}
.card {
  padding: 1rem;
  border-radius: 12px;
  background: #f9fafb;
}
`}</style>

This MDX file demonstrates **almost every common MDX capability** used in real portfolio blog websites.

<Callout title="Core Idea">
A portfolio blog is not about perfection. It is about <Highlight>clarity</Highlight>, consistency, and long-term value.
</Callout>

A portfolio blog website works silently in the background. While you sleep, your writing speaks for you.
This is why long-form content still matters in a short-form world.
